title: I Can Be
subtle: Descriptive (fiction), 62 words, Level C (Grade K), Lexile 130L
description: What can you pretend to be? This book prompts students to think imaginatively and comparatively as they describe themselves. Students will learn descriptive words that relate to themselves as well as to individual animals. Detailed, supportive illustrations and repetitive phrases support early readers.
meta: cheetah, meek, peacock, proud, silent, slug
Use the reading strategy of visualizing to understand the text
Reality and Fantasy : Identify reality/fantasy in ideas, situations, and events
Initial Consonants : Listen for and discriminate initial consonant /s/ sound
Subject : Recognize I as a simple subject in a sentence
High-Frequency Words : Recognize and use high-frequency words

Promote higher-order thinking for small groups
or whole class
